intro: Pahudia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other similar plants. The genus comprises several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials with showy, often yellow or orange flowers. Pahudia species typically grow in moist, well-drained soils and are found in grasslands and forest margins. They are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and their simple, usually five-lobed flowers.
